body.p: “I frequently see 3 or 4 old white birches standing together on the edge of a pond or meadow-& am struck by the pleasing manner in which they will commonly be grouped-how they spread so as to make room for each other-& make an agreeable impression on the eye- Methinks I have seen groups of 3 in different places arranged almost exactly alike. I saw these near Lily Bay. The 3d upright one is lapped over & partly twined round the middle one at base.”
